description.lang: The front is elegantly designed with a diffused backlight in each of the four pushbuttons. The pushbuttons can light up in all colors which can be used to show the status of a lamp, as orientation light during nighttime, visual alarm and much more.Each pushbutton is a tactile switch designed that can hold up to four functions and control either a wired lamp or other Z-Wave devices, e.g. other light dimmers, roller shutters and power outlets.The light dimmer can dim all dimmable light sources from 0-250 W.MATRIX ZDB5100 is designed to fit into all FUGA compatible wall boxes and cover frames.
Lifeline. Sends Device Reset notifications, and Central Scene notifications.
Sends Basic Report with information about the actual level for the dimmer. This report is used by other MATRIX devices that are used for controlling this dimmer.
Nodes in this group receive Binary Switch Set commands when pushbuttons 1-4 are operated. It can be used for controlling other Z-Wave devices, e.g. a relay module.

Nodes in this group receive Multi-Level Switch Set / Multi-Level Switch Start Level Change / Multi-Level Switch Stop Level Change when pushbuttons 1-4 are operated. It can, as an example, be used for controlling light dimmers.

This parameter specifies which pushbutton(s) that shall be used to control the built-in dimmer.The parameter is a bitmask, so each of the values can be added together in order to have several pushbuttons to operate the dimmer.
No local operation of the dimmer.
Pushbutton 1 controls the dimmer.
Pushbutton 2 controls the dimmer.
Pushbutton 3 controls the dimmer.
Pushbutton 4 controls the dimmer.
Pushbutton input debounce time in 0.01 seconds resolution.
02.55 seconds. Default is 5, which equals to a debounce-filter on 50 milliseconds (0.05 seconds)
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must be activated before it is detected as pressed. Resolution is in 0.01 seconds.
02.55 seconds. Default is 20, which equals to 200 milliseconds (0.2 seconds).
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must have been activated before it is accepted as held-down. Resolution is 0.01 seconds.
02.55 seconds. Default is 50, which equals to 500 milliseconds (0,5 seconds).

This parameter specifies a common brightness for each of the three base colours for all four pushbutton indicators.Byte 1: Red brightness. Byte 2: Green brightness. Byte 3: Blue brightness. Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 3: Brightness level for the blue colour in the 4 indicator groups. (Default is 255)
Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte1: Brightness level for the red colour in the 4 indicator groups. (Default is 255)
Byte 2: Brightness level for the green colour in the 4 indicator groups. (Default is 255)

name.lang: Associations groups, transmission when included secure

description.lang: This parameter specifies if commands are transmitted as a secure message for each of the association groups.This parameter is only used when the device is included in security mode (either S0 or S2). The values are bitmasks that can be added up to select several options.
All messages in all groups are sent as insecure.
Messages in association group 2 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 3 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 4 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 5 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 6 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 7 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 8 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 9 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 10 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 11 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 12 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 13 is sent as secure.
Messages in association group 14 is sent as secure.
Messages in all association groups are sent as secure.
This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 1.
Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down.
Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Always turn off or dim down . Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send off or dim down commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send on or dim up commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if previous parameter has value 1 or 2.
Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes.

name.lang: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 1

description.lang: Byte 1: Enable / DisableByte 2: Upper switch valueByte 3: Lower switch valueByte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 1: DisabledA single activation of the button will not result in commands are sent to devices in association group 4.
Byte 2: When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4.
Byte 3: When single pressing the button for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 0)
Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0
Byte 1: EnabledA single activation will result in commands are sent to devices in association group 4, they will receive commands with the values set below. (Default).
Byte 2: When single pressing the button for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 255)

name.lang: Binary Switch Set support for pushbutton 1

description.lang: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.
Binary Switch Set only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups

This parameter specifies the duration of a full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%. A regulation of the light with 1% will take 1/100 of the specified duration. This is used when a pushbutton is held-down for controlling the dimming, and when the dimming is fulfilled from other Z-Wave devices.
Immediately
Duration in seconds.
Duration in minutes (minus 127) from 1128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute
This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.
Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch statuswith inverted functionality
Same as 1
Same as 2
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

name.lang: Colour commands for pushbutton 1 LED indication

description.lang: This parameter specifies how Command Class Switch Color commands are handled.
Direct control; the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 127)

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 47)
This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 2.
Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down.
Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Always turn off or dim down. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send off or dim down commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send on or dim up commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if previous parameter has value 1 or 2.
Enhanced LED control is disabled
Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes
Enhanced LED control is enabled

name.lang: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 2

description.lang: Byte 1: Enable / Disable.Byte 2: Upper switch value.Byte 3: Lower switch value.Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 1: DisabledA single activation of the pushbutton will not send commands to devices in association group 4
Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 3: When single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 0)
Byte 2: When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 255)
Byte 1: EnabledA single activation will send commands to devices in association group 4. Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (Default)
Byte 2: When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 255)

name.lang: Binary Switch Set support for pushbutton 2

description.lang: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.
Binary Switch Set only controls the button indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set controls the internal switch status and the button indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set is handled as if the user had activated the button, including transmission of commands via the association groups
This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.
Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch statuswith inverted functionality
Same as 1
Same as 2
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

name.lang: Colour commands for pushbutton 2 LED indication

description.lang: This parameter specifies how Command Class Switch Color commands is handled.
Direct control; the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
Colour command sets the colour for ON indication
This parameter specifies the duration when turning the light on or off.
Immediately
Time in seconds
Time in minutes (minus 127) from 1128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 1:Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 127)
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter (Default is 0)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs (Default is 47)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs (Default is 47)
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs (Default is 47)
This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 3.
Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Always turn off or dim down. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send off or dim down commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send on or dim up commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual)
This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if previous parameter has value 1 or 2.
Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes

name.lang: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 3

description.lang: Byte 1: Enable / Disable.Byte 2: Upper switch value.Byte 3: Lower switch value.Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0
Byte 3: When single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 0)
Byte 1: DisabledA single activation of the pushbutton will not send commands to devices in association group 4
Byte 2: When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4
Byte 1: EnabledA single activation will send commands to devices in association group 4. Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (default)
Byte 2: When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (default)

name.lang: Binary Switch Set support for pushbutton 3

description.lang: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.
Binary Switch Set only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups
This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.
Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch statuswith inverted functionality
Same as 1
Same as 2
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

name.lang: Colour commands for pushbutton 3 LED indication

description.lang: This parameter specifies how Command Class Switch Color commands is handled
Direct control; the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 127)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 47).
The dimmer can work in three different modes: on/off, leading edge or trailing edge.
No dimming, only on/off (0/100%).
Trailing edge dimming
Leading edge dimming
This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 4.
Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter.
Always turn off or dim down. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send off or dim down commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual).
Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send on or dim up commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3 (see chapter 2.6 in the manual).
This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if previous parameter has value 1 or 2.
Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes

name.lang: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 4

description.lang: Byte 1: Enable / Disable.Byte 2: Upper switch value.Byte 3: Lower switch value.Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 4: Not usedmust be set to 0.
Byte 2: When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4
Byte 1: DisabledA single activation of the pushbutton will not send commands to devices in association group 4.
Byte 3: When single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 0)
Byte 1: EnabledA single activation will send commands to devices in association group 4. Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (Default).
Byte 2: When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default)

name.lang: Binary Switch Set support for pushbutton 4

description.lang: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.
Binary Switch Set only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups
This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.
Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication.
The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch statuswith inverted functionality
Same as 1
Same as 2
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

name.lang: Colour commands for pushbutton 4 LED indication

description.lang: This parameter specifies how Command Class Switch Color commands are handled.
Direct control; the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 127)
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)

This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).Byte 1: Colour saturation, red.Byte 2: Colour saturation, green.Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue.Byte 4: LED control.
Byte 1: Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 2: Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 4: LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)
Byte 3: Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 47)
This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.
Corresponds to 099%
This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%.
Corresponds to 099%
This parameter can be used for disabling Central Scene notifications.
Notifications are disabled
Notifications are enabled
This parameter specifies the reaction when double-activating the pushbuttons.
Double-activation disabled
Double-activation sets light to 100%

This parameter can be used for disabling the Z-Wave network add/remove process when triple-activating pushbutton 1. If disabled, the triple-activation functionality can be used as a Central Scene notification.
Triple-activation of pushbutton 1, does not start the add/remove process.
Triple-activation of pushbutton 1, starts the add/remove process
